data.description:
## Problem
Several entity fields accept Dict[str, Any] without structure validation:
- properties: All entities
- metadata: Task, Sprint, Epic, Document
- context: Handoff
- result: Handoff
- goals: Sprint (List[Dict])
- phases: Epic (List[Dict])

## Current State
These fields are typed as Dict[str, Any] or List[Dict], allowing arbitrary structure. No validation of:
- Expected keys
- Value types
- Required vs optional fields
- Nesting depth limits

## Solution
Define TypedDict or dataclass schemas for each:

```python
class TaskProperties(TypedDict, total=False):
    category: str
    retrospective: str
    tags: List[str]
    estimated_hours: float

class TaskMetadata(TypedDict, total=False):
    completed_at: str
    updated_at: str
    created_by: str

class SprintGoal(TypedDict):
    description: str
    completed: bool
    progress: float  # 0.0-1.0

class EpicPhase(TypedDict):
    name: str
    status: str
    sprints: List[str]
```

## Files
- cortical/got/types.py (add TypedDict definitions)
- cortical/got/entity_schemas.py (add field validators)

## Acceptance Criteria
1. All nested structures have formal type definitions
2. Validation warns on unknown keys (not fails, for extensibility)
3. Required fields within nested structures are enforced
4. Documentation generated from type definitions
data.title: Define schemas for nested Dict structures (properties, metadata, goals, phases)
